New Records: Jasprit Bumrah took 4 wickets for 7 runs in 4 overs, the second-fewest conceded by an Indian in a men's T20I
Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav played a crucial knock, scoring 41 off 21 balls with a strike rate of 450 with the sweep shot
Rishabh Pant scored 7 off 2 balls after Rohit Sharma's dismissal
Virat Kohli was dismissed for 13 off 14 balls
Rashid Khan took out Dube with a legbreak that dipped sharply
Pant was dismissed lbw to Rashid Khan in the process of a review
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma likes the look of the pitch for run-scoring, and believes as the game goes on, it will get slower and slower
Rashid Khan takes the disadvantage of batting first in men's T20Is on the chin and says its about doing the right thing at the right time
Post-Match Reflections: India's batters did well to upset the rhythm of the game, never going into their shell even as Afghanistan struck early
India's bowlers have benefited from how no one apart from Rahmanullah Gurbaz really came at them
India's riches are the envy of the world, with their ability to call up one of T20I cricket's most fearsome strike forces, like Kuldeep Yadav
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was tough to bat on, slow and offering purchase to everyone willing to roll their fingers across the ball
Afghanistan coach Jonathan Trott mentioned that they will thrive in these conditions, and they made the early breakthrough with Fazalhaq Farooqi dismissing Rohit Sharma early
